intro: Cattleya sulphurea, commonly known as the sulphur cattleya, is a tropical orchid native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers with a contrasting deep orange lip. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to tree trunks and branches in its natural habitat. Its leaves are broad and革质, providing structural support and efficient water retention. Cattleya sulphurea is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
